alert.note: Alert for Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 9:21PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Graham County through 945 PM CDT... At 920 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Nicodemus, or 10 miles northeast of Hill City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Graham County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Kansas.
